Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The subcutaneous injection of isoproterenol ( 30 mg / kg ) into rats twice at an interval of 24 h , for two consecutive days , led to a significant increase in serum lactate dehydrogenase , creatine phosphokinase , alanine transaminase , aspartate transaminase , and angiotensin - converting enzyme activities , total cholesterol , triglycerides , free serum fatty acid , cardiac tissue malondialdehyde ( MDA ) , and nitric oxide levels and a significant decrease in levels of glutathione and superoxide dismutase in cardiac tissue as compared to the normal control group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease or Condition |
|----------------------|
| Increased serum lactate dehydrogenase activity |
| Increased serum creatine phosphokinase activity |
| Increased serum alanine transaminase activity |
| Increased serum aspartate transaminase activity |
| Increased angiotensin-converting enzyme activities |
| Increased total cholesterol |
| Increased triglycerides |
| Increased free serum fatty acid |
| Decreased levels of glutathione in cardiac tissue |
| Decreased levels of superoxide dismutase in cardiac tissue |
| Increased cardiac tissue malondialdehyde (MDA) |
| Increased nitric oxide levels |

These entities represent the biochemical changes observed in the rats after being injected with isoproterenol.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease or Condition |
|----------------------|
| Increased serum lactate dehydrogenase activity |
| Increased serum creatine phosphokinase activity |
| Increased serum alanine transaminase activity |
| Increased serum aspartate transaminase activity |
| Decreased levels of glutathione in cardiac tissue |
| Decreased levels of superoxide dismutase in cardiac tissue |

These entities represent the biochemical changes in the rats that can be considered as indicators of disease or condition. The other mentioned entities, such as isoproterenol injection, normal control group, and P value, do not clearly refer to diseases or conditions.
